title: Manchester's Arndale shopping centre is evacuated as group of youths throw 'chemical' at staff
text:
Manchester's Arndale shopping centre was evacuated earlier today after a group of youths threw 'some kind of chemical' at security staff before two 16-year-old boys were arrested.

Police swarmed to the centre on Market Street, Manchester, at around 6pm today.

Shoppers said that they were confronted by a 'riot van, four police cars and an ambulance' before being evacuated out of the building.

Manchester's Arndale shopping centre was evacuated earlier today after a group of youths threw 'some kind of chemical' at security staff

Videos online have emerged of some shoppers screaming in panic as they tried to get out of the popular shopping destination.

Feroze Bilal claimed that he was just yards away when some kind of 'chemical' was released by the large group of both girls and boys.

He said: 'I could feel it, it was irritating and I was coughing and sneezing.

'People started running, it was quite a panicked situation.

'Police and security got people out of there.'

Police swarmed to the centre on Market Street, Manchester, at around 6pm today and helped security guards evacuate shoppers

The evacuees fled out into Exchange Square where trams were temporarily forced to stop running

The evacuees fled out into Exchange Square where trams were temporarily forced to stop running.

Another witness claimed they saw pepper spray being used by police - but this has not been confirmed.

A spokesperson for Greater Manchester Police originally said: 'Police are currently dealing with an ongoing incident at the Arndale in Manchester.

A large group of youths were causing anti-social behaviour towards security staff on the second floor.

Shoppers said that they were confronted by a 'riot van, four police cars and an ambulance'

'The food court has been cleared and the group are slowly being dispersed out of the main entrance.

'There is currently a heavy police presence to ensure the safety of other members of the public.'

The force has since released an updated statement which said that two 16-year-old boys have been arrested for their involvement.

The rest of the group has been dispersed and the food court has been re-opened.
description: Police swarmed to the centre on Market Street, Manchester, at around 6pm today. Shoppers said that they were confronted by a 'riot van, four police cars and an ambulance' but it has since re-opened.
